dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Back in 2018, Elon Musk predicted Tesla would hit 5,000 Model 3s per week by the fourth quarter.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Back in twenty eighteen, Elon Musk predicted Tesla would hit five thousand Model 3s per week by the fourth quarter.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Musk had said early last year that production of Model 3, currently priced from $46,000, would reach 5,000 units per week in 2017s fourth quarter, and reiterated that target in July 2017 after production of it began in Fremont, California.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and according to the Wall Street Journal, the FBI is now reviewing those public comments to see if they misled investors.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and according to the Wall Street Journal, the F B I is now reviewing those public comments to see if they misled investors.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Federal Bureau of Investigation is reviewing public statements by the Palo Alto, California-based company dating back to early 2017 to determine if it misled investors based on what it said regarding its ability to produce the Model 3, according to The Wall Street Journal, citing unnamed people familiar with the matter.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: It took a full year longer than he said to actually reach that production pace, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It took a full year longer than he said to actually reach that production pace, right?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Ultimately, given difficulties that we did not foresee in this first-of-its-kind production ramp, it took us six months longer than we expected to meet our 5,000 unit per week guidance.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. They only built about 3,500 units last year, and even this year it's been intermittent.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. They only built about three thousand, five hundred units last year, and even this year it's been intermittent.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In fact, the company built only about 2,700 of the cars last year.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And now former Tesla employees are being contacted by the FBI for testimony in a criminal case.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And now former Tesla employees are being contacted by the F B I for testimony in a criminal case.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Former Tesla employees have been contacted by FBI agents seeking their testimony in a criminal case, the report said.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Which is separate from that SEC settlement over Musk's tweets about taking Tesla private.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which is separate from that S E C settlement over Musk's tweets about taking Tesla private.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The pace of activity in the investigation, which is led by the U.S. attorneys office in San Francisco, intensified after Musk and Tesla settled a dispute with the Securities and Exchange Commission stemming from his tweets in August about taking Tesla private, the report said.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right, where he had to step down as chairman and pay a $10 million fine.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, where he had to step down as chairman and pay a ten dollars million fine.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: As part of a settlement concluded this month, Musk agreed to step down as Teslas chairman, a position he assumed long before becoming its CEO, and pay a $20 million fine to settle the matter.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Tesla's also paying another $30 million and adding independent directors.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Tesla's also paying another thirty dollars million and adding independent directors.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Tesla also must pay a further $20 million and add two independent directors to its board.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: But despite all that, their stock actually went up after the quarterly results.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But despite all that, their stock actually went up after the quarterly results.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Tesla shares surged 15%, or by $42.40, to $330.90 in the days following its surprise quarterly results.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Up 10 percent, which is wild given all this scrutiny.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Up ten percent, which is wild given all this scrutiny.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Tesla shares surged 15%, or by $42.40, to $330.90 in the days following its surprise quarterly results.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Tesla's defense is that they set "truthful targets," not sandbagged or unrealistic ones.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Tesla's defense is that they set truthful targets, not sandbagged or unrealistic ones.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Tesla defended its past statements, and that its philosophy has always been to set truthful targets not sandbagged targets that we would definitely exceed and not unrealistic targets that we could never meet.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: They called it "production hell," honestly, which I kinda respect—they were transparent about the struggle.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: They called it production hell, honestly, which I kinda respect-they were transparent about the struggle.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: When we started the Model 3 production ramp, we were transparent about how difficult it would be, openly explaining that we would only be able to go as fast as our least lucky or least successful supplier and that we were entering production hell, the company said.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Still, a twelve-month delay is a big deal when you're promising specific numbers to shareholders.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Still, a twelve-month delay is a big deal when you're promising specific numbers to shareholders.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Ultimately, given difficulties that we did not foresee in this first-of-its-kind production ramp, it took us six months longer than we expected to meet our 5,000 unit per week guidance.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And now with the DOJ and FBI involved, it's not going away anytime soon.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And now with the D O J and F B I involved, it's not going away anytime soon.

artist_script:
HostA: Back in 2018, Elon Musk predicted Tesla would hit 5,000 Model 3s per week by the fourth quarter.
HostB: Yeah, and according to the Wall Street Journal, the FBI is now reviewing those public comments to see if they misled investors.
HostA: It took a full year longer than he said to actually reach that production pace, right?
HostB: Exactly. They only built about 3,500 units last year, and even this year it’s been intermittent.
HostA: And now former Tesla employees are being contacted by the FBI for testimony in a criminal case.
HostB: Which is separate from that SEC settlement over Musk’s tweets about taking Tesla private.
HostA: Right, where he had to step down as chairman and pay a $10 million fine.
HostB: Tesla’s also paying another $30 million and adding independent directors.
HostA: But despite all that, their stock actually went up after the quarterly results.
HostB: Up 10 percent, which is wild given all this scrutiny.
HostA: Tesla’s defense is that they set “truthful targets,” not sandbagged or unrealistic ones.
HostB: They called it “production hell,” honestly, which I kinda respect—they were transparent about the struggle.
HostA: Still, a twelve-month delay is a big deal when you’re promising specific numbers to shareholders.
HostB: And now with the DOJ and FBI involved, it’s not going away anytime soon.
